body_html: No, I think there's no way to do that in torch/lib. You need a way to refcount these files, but THRefcountingMapAllocator alone doesn't cut it, because if someone kills the process with a SIGKILL the files won't be deleted and they will keep consuming RAM. That's why I wrote libshm and this is probably what we should use in here (it spawns a separate deamon that is not affected by any signals sent to the main process, and will unlink all the files once the process exits).

body: No, I think there's no way to do that in `torch/lib`. You need a way to refcount these files, but `THRefcountingMapAllocator` alone doesn't cut it, because if someone kills the process with a `SIGKILL` the files won't be deleted and they will keep consuming RAM. That's why I wrote `libshm` and this is probably what we should use in here (it spawns a separate deamon that is not affected by any signals sent to the main process, and will unlink all the files once the process exits).
